P-4 P4114 Nissan Violet Turbo Super Silhouette 1979 Fuji Masters 250km Winner H. Yanagida



The Japanese Touring Car Championship started in the late 1960s. With the emergence of Group 5 cars in the later half of the 1970s, the series was replaced by Super Silhouettes in 1979, which was held as a support race to the Fuji Grand Champion Series. The field for the inaugural event in 1979 consisted of Japanâ€™s Group 5 cars from the years prior. One of those cars was the Turbo Violet which was raced 5 years earlier and mainly outside of Japan due to the oil crisis. Haru Yanagida drove the sole Violet - seen below - to victory in the 1979 Fuji Masters 250km.

The model was one of the last released by the sorely missed (by me, anyway) Japanese model shop P-4.
